files.content:
Camp near Richmond, Virginia
April 12, 1863

My Dearest Sarah,

The spring rains have turned our encampment into a sea of mud. The men's spirits remain high despite the difficult conditions. We received news yesterday that General Lee is planning a major offensive northward. I pray this conflict will soon come to an end.

Supplies are running low. We are down to hardtack and salt pork. The quartermaster promises new provisions by week's end.

I think of you and the children constantly. Please give them my love.

Your devoted husband,
James

files.name: letter-002.pdf.ref.json
files.content:
Richmond, Virginia
July 8, 1863

Dearest James,

Your letter of June 15th arrived yesterday. We were overjoyed to hear from you. The news from Gettysburg has reached us here - we pray for your safe return.

The children are well. Little Thomas asks about you daily. Elizabeth has begun helping me with the garden, which provides much of our food now.

The city is transformed. Nearly every building serves as a hospital. I volunteer three days a week rolling bandages and tending to the wounded.

Come home safely to us.

All my love,
Sarah

files.content:
AFTER ACTION REPORT
12th Virginia Infantry
Battle of Brandy Station
June 9, 1863

At 0430 hours, Union cavalry under General Pleasonton crossed the Rappahannock River. Our regiment was positioned on the right flank near Fleetwood Hill.

Casualties:
Killed: 7
Wounded: 23
Missing: 2

The engagement lasted approximately 6 hours. Enemy was repulsed but at significant cost. Ammunition expenditure was heavy - approximately 40 rounds per man.

Recommend: Immediate resupply and 48 hours rest for the men.

Submitted by:
Captain James R. Patterson
Company A, 12th Virginia Infantry

# Civil War Collection - 12th Virginia Infantry

This collection contains correspondence, military records, and photographs from the 12th Virginia Infantry Regiment during the American Civil War (1861-1865).

## Contents

- Personal letters between Captain James R. Patterson and his wife Sarah
- Military rosters and reports
- Quartermaster supply records
- Period photographs

## Historical Context

The 12th Virginia Infantry was part of the Army of Northern Virginia and participated in several major engagements including Brandy Station and Gettysburg.

## Provenance

Donated by the Patterson family in 1952.
